column1: Smoque BBQ////This place is probably as good as BBQ gets in Chicago (and I'm a bit disappointed given Chicago has such wonderful food/restaurants/eateries). It's definitely not a top-tier BBQ place. The ribs
column4: but could be quite dry and overcooked. The cole slaw was rather enjoyable with a vinegar-based dressing (I'm accustomed to mayonnaise being from the south). The brisket chili was nothing special
column5: with the brisket not adding much to the party. The menu is also more pricey than I'm accustomed to paying for BBQ
column6: but this isn't a large point given it's in/near Chicago.
